goals.question: What is the distribution of the budget amounts across all departments?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of budget amounts across all departments and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the average budget amount for each department?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of the 'department' field against the mean of the 'budget_amount' field
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us compare the budget amounts of each department and identify which departments have higher or lower budgets.

goals.question: What is the trend of budget amounts over the years?
goals.visualization: Line chart of the 'year' field against the sum of the 'budget_amount' field
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand how the budget amounts have changed over the years and identify any trends or patterns.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the number of employees in each department?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of the number of employees across all departments and identify any outliers.

goals.question: Is there a correlation between the number of employees and the budget amount for each department?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of the 'num_employees' field against the 'budget_amount' field for each department
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify if there is a positive or negative correlation between the number of employees and the budget amount for each department.

code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['budget_amount'], bins=20)
    plt.xlabel('Budget Amount')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the budget amounts across all departments?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    avg_budget = data.groupby('department')['budget_amount'].mean()
    avg_budget.plot(kind='bar')
    
    plt.xlabel('Department')
    plt.ylabel('Average Budget Amount')
    plt.title('What is the average budget amount for each department?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['year'], format='%Y', errors='ignore')
    yearly_budget = data.groupby('year')['budget_amount'].sum()
    
    plt.plot(yearly_budget.index, yearly_budget.values)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    plt.title("What is the trend of budget amounts over the years?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['num_employees'], bins='auto', edgecolor='black')
    plt.xlabel('Number of Employees')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the number of employees in each department?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['num_employees'], data['budget_amount'])
    plt.xlabel('Number of Employees')
    plt.ylabel('Budget Amount')
    plt.title('Is there a correlation between the number of employees and the budget amount for each department?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
